intro: Pyrenoglyphis bicuspidata, commonly known as the two-spined pyrenoglyph, is a unique species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its small, compact growth form and distinctive leaf structure with two spines on the margins. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocky substrates or in damp forest floors. Its reproductive structures, known as calyptrae, are highly specialized and play a crucial role in its spore dispersal. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and often overlooked member of the bryophyte community.
